title: Diagnostics of Diseases of Dental Tissues
short_description: Dental caries is a scientific term for tooth decay or tooth cavities. The natural bacteria that lives in our mouth can build up into a colourless sticky film called plaque.
description: Dental caries is a scientific term for tooth decay or tooth cavities. The natural bacteria that lives in our mouth can build up into a colourless sticky film called plaque. This plaque if not regularly brushed away, builds up and collects in the grooves on our teeth surfaces, spaces between teeth and around the gum line.
